title: Cookdata
author: Cookdata
content: My mobile data was left on and I received a notification on my email that ltcgambler self moderate one of the thread he started on gambling discussing and deleted every replied post, it is now deleted, I try to go through the [Achive] thread, it was a nice discussion thread until he changed the subject to daily odd and prediction, later deleted the whole thread.Why did you do that ltcgambler?To do the main question, I open the notification email on my phone but while accessing Bitcointalk pm, I saw something new for the first time on my chrome browser.Have you noticed this notification on your browser? Did I enabled any settings that I'm not aware?

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Haven't you never received any messages before? That's the alert message when you receive a message which is the deleted post.Although it can be disabled/enable on your message settings but its the default settings I suppose since I never change anything on that page.

comments.author: Foxpup
comments.body: You have (perhaps accidentally) enabled "Show a popup when you receive new messages" in your Personal Message Options. This option isn't just for mobile browsers, and is a standard feature of SMF, so it's always been there - you just must not have noticed it before.

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: Cookdata on May 11, 2022, 11:19:48 AMWhy did you do that ltcgambler?Well he has full right to delete all posts he made, including posts from other members in self-moderated topics created by him.He probably won't use that account anymore so he decided to delete all history of posting for privacy reasons, but you can always read his archived posts.It probably hurt you more because you wrote on that topic  Quote from: Cookdata on May 11, 2022, 11:19:48 AMHave you noticed this notification on your browser? Did I enabled any settings that I'm not aware?Yes I did notice this notifications before, but you can always disable most of them in settings if you don't like them.

comments.author: Cookdata
comments.body: Quote from: Foxpup on May 11, 2022, 11:47:24 AM_snip_Thanks man! I preferred using it this way as I don't usually attend to PMS, it will help me quickly attend to them anytime I skipped mail notifications.Quote from: dkbit98 on May 11, 2022, 01:10:21 PMIt probably hurt you more because you wrote on that topic  You felt my pain, it is very annoying.  Thanks everyone for responses, the thread is now closed.
